intro: Scorzonera sahnea, commonly known as the Sahnean scorzonera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to regions of the Mediterranean and parts of Central Asia, where it thrives in dry, rocky soils. The plant produces yellow flowers with prominent central disks, and its leaves are typically hairy and lance-shaped. Scorzonera sahnea is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal. It also has historical uses in traditional medicine.
